oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Implementation scheme for End-to-end Quality of Service (QoS) sessions over Internet
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JOSHI, R
SARAPH, GP
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: With the significant increase in the internet applications and services which have definite QoS requirements and the resources on the internet being shared, the need of end-to-end QoS sessions has become critical. The existing QoS mechanisms provide the path selection mechanism in distributed manner which do not necessarily support the end-to-end QoS requirements. We build propose an evolutionary framework which provides support for optimal end-to-end QoS sessions. Implementation of end to end QoS sessions fall under three distinct planes: Session Control Plane, Network Control Plane and Data Forwarding Plane. In this paper we describe the implementation requirements, various choices and the implementation scheme for building end-to-end QoS sessions over internet.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: ANTS: 2008 2ND INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCED NETWORKS AND TELECOMMUNICATION SYSTEMS,55-57
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 2nd International Symposium on Advanced Networks and Telecommunication Systems,Mumbai, INDIA,DEC 15-17, 2008
